intro: Chaetopappa laxa, commonly known as the slenderleaf composite, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with gray-green, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chaetopappa laxa is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats.
